perturbation.original_text:
2. Period of transportation services: this Agreement is valid for an indefinite term. Subsequent contracts might be entered in case of special
business.
perturbation.changed_text:
2. Period of transportation services: this Agreement is valid for an indefinite term. Subsequent contracts might be entered in case of special
business.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, this agreement shall automatically terminate if Party B fails to meet Party A's service standards for two consecutive months.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the agreement's term. Originally, it's indefinite. The added clause allows for termination based on performance, creating uncertainty about the actual duration and conditions for termination.

perturbation.original_text:
5. In order to guarantee rapid transfer of Party A’s parcel, Party B shall strictly comply with the following obligations:
 
(a) During the transportation, Part B shall completely comply with Party A’s transportation arrangement and relevant systems. Party B shall
bear any consequences and legal liability arising out of Party B’s non-compliance, and Party A shall have no liability. Party A has
the right to terminate this Agreement without further legal liability in the case that Party B does not comply with Party A’s
management and arrangement.
perturbation.changed_text:
5. In order to guarantee rapid transfer of Party A’s parcel, Party B shall strictly comply with the following obligations:
 
(a) During the transportation, Part B shall completely comply with Party A’s transportation arrangement and relevant systems. Party B shall
bear any consequences and legal liability arising out of Party B’s non-compliance, and Party A shall have no liability. Party A has
the right to terminate this Agreement without further legal liability in the case that Party B does not comply with Party A’s
management and arrangement.

However, Party B's non-compliance must be deemed "gross negligence" by a mutually agreed-upon arbitrator before Party A can exercise its right to terminate.
perturbation.explanation: This adds a condition to Party A's right to terminate. The original clause allows termination for *any* non-compliance. The addition requires a determination of "gross negligence" by an arbitrator, conflicting with the immediate termination right and adding a layer of dispute resolution that wasn't there before. This makes the enforcement of the original clause uncertain.

perturbation.original_text:
10. Party B shall obtain Party A’s written consent in the case the early termination of the Agreement. Party B shall pay one-month freight as
liquidated damages in case of termination of the Agreement without consent. Within the contract period, Party B shall not charge the
freight difference if Party A rents same-level vehicles. Party B shall also compensate Party A’s other losses.
perturbation.changed_text:
10. Party B shall obtain Party A’s written consent in the case the early termination of the Agreement. Party B shall pay one-month freight as
liquidated damages in case of termination of the Agreement without consent. Within the contract period, Party B shall not charge the
freight difference if Party A rents same-level vehicles. Party B shall also compensate Party A’s other losses.

However, if Party B provides 90 days written notice of its intent to terminate, the requirement for Party A's consent is waived, and no liquidated damages shall be due.
perturbation.explanation: This change contradicts the requirement for Party A's consent for early termination and the associated liquidated damages. The added clause allows Party B to terminate without consent or penalty if they provide 90 days' notice, directly conflicting with the original terms. This introduces ambiguity about the conditions for early termination and creates uncertainty about whether liquidated damages will be applied.
